_description: Humfrey Newton, A lover’s lament — seven 8-line stanzas

BodLatMisC66.First Lines:
Alas a thousand sith alasfor one that is os ble so
                    briȝt…
BodLatMisC66.Last Lines:
…I talid you how longe I wold abidye said alas how shall I do
                    so longe
BodLatMisC66.Note: Imperfect in the middle, about seven stanzas legible.
BodLatMisC66.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “The Poems of Humphrey Newton, Esquire, 1466-1536.” 
             PMLA
         65 (1950): 249-81: 272-4.
Silverstein,  Theodore,
                        ed.  
             Medieval English Lyrics.
         York Medieval Texts. London: Edw. Arnold, 1971: 159-61.
